Detailed Description

TaskReader class.

The task reader is a convenient class which reads a task description from a stream (for example cin or a file). It provides some convenient functions to get named parameters and dispatcher settings.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TaskReader::TaskReader (  ) 

Create new task reader.

This creates an empty task reader.

See also:
ReadRequest
TaskReader::TaskReader ( std::istream &  stream  ) 

Create new task reader for an input stream.

Create a new task reader which starts reading the task from the specified input stream.

void TaskReader::ReadRequest ( messages::task::Task const &  task  )  [protected]

Set task description.

Set the task description directly. This can be used in subclasses of TaskReader when a task might be read from something other than a stream.
